title: AWS Database Migration Service
description:
AWS Database Migration Service

AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS) can migrate your data to and from the most widely used commercial and open-source databases such as Oracle, PostgreSQL, Microsoft SQL Server, Amazon Redshift, MariaDB, Amazon Aurora, MySQL, and SAP Adaptive Server Enterprise (ASE). The service supports homogeneous migrations such as Oracle to Oracle, as well as heterogeneous migrations between different database platforms, such as Oracle to MySQL or SQL Server to PostgreSQL.

For more information about AWS DMS, see the AWS DMS user guide at [What Is AWS Database Migration Service?](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/dms/latest/userguide/Welcome.html)

AccessDeniedFault.description: AWS DMS was denied access to the endpoint.
AccessDeniedFault.title: AccessDeniedFault

AccountQuota.description: Describes a quota for an AWS account, for example, the number of replication instances allowed.

AccountQuotaName.description: The name of the AWS DMS quota for this AWS account.

Max.description: The maximum allowed value for the quota.

Used.description: The amount currently used toward the quota maximum.

AccountQuota.title: AccountQuota

ResourceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS DMS resource the tag is to be added to. AWS DMS resources include a replication instance, endpoint, and a replication task.

Tags.description: The tag to be assigned to the DMS resource.

Name.description: The name of the availability zone.

Certificate.description: The SSL certificate that can be used to encrypt connections between the endpoints and the replication instance.

CertificateArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the certificate.

CertificateCreationDate.description: The date that the certificate was created.

CertificateIdentifier.description: The customer-assigned name of the certificate. Valid characters are A-z and 0-9.

CertificatePem.description: The contents of the .pem X.509 certificate file for the certificate.

CertificateWallet.description: The location of the imported Oracle Wallet certificate for use with SSL.

KeyLength.description: The key length of the cryptographic algorithm being used.

SigningAlgorithm.description: The signing algorithm for the certificate.

ValidFromDate.description: The beginning date that the certificate is valid.

ValidToDate.description: The final date that the certificate is valid.

Certificate.title: Certificate

EndpointArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.

EndpointIdentifier.description: The identifier of the endpoint. Identifiers must begin with a letter; must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens; and must not end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

LastFailureMessage.description: The error message when the connection last failed.

ReplicationInstanceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.

ReplicationInstanceIdentifier.description: The replication instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a lowercase string.

CertificateArn.description: The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) for the certificate.

DatabaseName.description: The name of the endpoint database.

DynamoDbSettings.description: Settings in JSON format for the target Amazon DynamoDB endpoint. For more information about the available settings, see the Using Object Mapping to Migrate Data to DynamoDB section at Using an Amazon DynamoDB Database as a Target for AWS Database Migration Service.

EndpointIdentifier.description: The database endpoint identifier. Identifiers must begin with a letter; must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens; and must not end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

EngineName.description: The type of engine for the endpoint. Valid values, depending on the EndPointType, include MYSQL, ORACLE, POSTGRES, MARIADB, AURORA, REDSHIFT, S3, SYBASE, DYNAMODB, MONGODB, and SQLSERVER.

ExtraConnectionAttributes.description: Additional attributes associated with the connection.

KmsKeyId.description: The KMS key identifier that will be used to encrypt the connection parameters. If you do not specify a value for the KmsKeyId parameter, then AWS DMS will use your default encryption key. AWS KMS creates the default encryption key for your AWS account. Your AWS account has a different default encryption key for each AWS region.

MongoDbSettings.description: Settings in JSON format for the source MongoDB endpoint. For more information about the available settings, see the Configuration Properties When Using MongoDB as a Source for AWS Database Migration Service section at Using Amazon S3 as a Target for AWS Database Migration Service.

Password.description: The password to be used to login to the endpoint database.

Port.description: The port used by the endpoint database.

S3Settings.description: Settings in JSON format for the target S3 endpoint. For more information about the available settings, see the Extra Connection Attributes section at Using Amazon S3 as a Target for AWS Database Migration Service.

ServerName.description: The name of the server where the endpoint database resides.

SslMode.description:
The SSL mode to use for the SSL connection.

SSL mode can be one of four values: none, require, verify-ca, verify-full.

The default value is none.

Tags.description: Tags to be added to the endpoint.

Username.description: The user name to be used to login to the endpoint database.

Enabled.description: A Boolean value; set to true to activate the subscription, or set to false to create the subscription but not activate it.

EventCategories.description: A list of event categories for a source type that you want to subscribe to. You can see a list of the categories for a given source type by calling the DescribeEventCategories action or in the topic Working with Events and Notifications in the AWS Database Migration Service User Guide.

SnsTopicArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic created for event notification. The ARN is created by Amazon SNS when you create a topic and subscribe to it.

SourceIds.description: The list of identifiers of the event sources for which events will be returned. If not specified, then all sources are included in the response. An identifier must begin with a letter and must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens; it cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

SourceType.description:
The type of AWS DMS resource that generates the events. For example, if you want to be notified of events generated by a replication instance, you set this parameter to replication-instance. If this value is not specified, all events are returned.

Valid values: replication-instance | migration-task

SubscriptionName.description:
The name of the DMS event notification subscription.

Constraints: The name must be less than 255 characters.

Tags.description: A tag to be attached to the event subscription.

EventSubscription.description: The event subscription that was created.

AllocatedStorage.description: The amount of storage (in gigabytes) to be initially allocated for the replication instance.

AutoMinorVersionUpgrade.description:
Indicates that minor engine upgrades will be applied automatically to the replication instance during the maintenance window.

Default: true

AvailabilityZone.description:
The EC2 Availability Zone that the replication instance will be created in.

Default: A random, system-chosen Availability Zone in the endpoint's region.

Example: us-east-1d

EngineVersion.description: The engine version number of the replication instance.

KmsKeyId.description: The KMS key identifier that will be used to encrypt the content on the replication instance. If you do not specify a value for the KmsKeyId parameter, then AWS DMS will use your default encryption key. AWS KMS creates the default encryption key for your AWS account. Your AWS account has a different default encryption key for each AWS region.

MultiAZ.description: Specifies if the replication instance is a Multi-AZ deployment. You cannot set the AvailabilityZone parameter if the Multi-AZ parameter is set to true.

PreferredMaintenanceWindow.description:
The weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).

Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi

Default: A 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour block of time per region, occurring on a random day of the week.

Valid Days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun

Constraints: Minimum 30-minute window.

PubliclyAccessible.description: Specifies the accessibility options for the replication instance. A value of true represents an instance with a public IP address. A value of false represents an instance with a private IP address. The default value is true.

ReplicationInstanceClass.description:
The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as specified by the replication instance class.

Valid Values: dms.t2.micro | dms.t2.small | dms.t2.medium | dms.t2.large | dms.c4.large | dms.c4.xlarge | dms.c4.2xlarge | dms.c4.4xlarge

ReplicationInstanceIdentifier.description:
The replication instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a lowercase string.

Constraints:

  • Must contain from 1 to 63 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.

  • First character must be a letter.

  • Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

Example: myrepinstance

ReplicationSubnetGroupIdentifier.description: A subnet group to associate with the replication instance.

Tags.description: Tags to be associated with the replication instance.

VpcSecurityGroupIds.description: Specifies the VPC security group to be used with the replication instance. The VPC security group must work with the VPC containing the replication instance.

ReplicationInstance.description: The replication instance that was created.

ReplicationSubnetGroupDescription.description: The description for the subnet group.

ReplicationSubnetGroupIdentifier.description:
The name for the replication subnet group. This value is stored as a lowercase string.

Constraints: Must contain no more than 255 alphanumeric characters, periods, spaces, underscores, or hyphens. Must not be "default".

Example: mySubnetgroup

SubnetIds.description: The EC2 subnet IDs for the subnet group.

Tags.description: The tag to be assigned to the subnet group.

ReplicationSubnetGroup.description: The replication subnet group that was created.

CdcStartTime.description: The start time for the Change Data Capture (CDC) operation.

ReplicationInstanceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.

ReplicationTaskIdentifier.description:
The replication task identifier.

Constraints:

  • Must contain from 1 to 255 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.

  • First character must be a letter.

  • Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

ReplicationTaskSettings.description: Settings for the task, such as target metadata settings. For a complete list of task settings, see Task Settings for AWS Database Migration Service Tasks.

SourceEndpointArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.

TableMappings.description:
When using the AWS CLI or boto3, provide the path of the JSON file that contains the table mappings. Precede the path with "file://". When working with the DMS API, provide the JSON as the parameter value.

For example, --table-mappings file://mappingfile.json

Tags.description: Tags to be added to the replication instance.

TargetEndpointArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.

ReplicationTask.description: The replication task that was created.

CertificateArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the deleted certificate.

EndpointArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.

SubscriptionName.description: The name of the DMS event notification subscription to be deleted.

EventSubscription.description: The event subscription that was deleted.

ReplicationInstanceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance to be deleted.

ReplicationInstance.description: The replication instance that was deleted.

ReplicationSubnetGroupIdentifier.description: The subnet group name of the replication instance.

ReplicationTaskArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication task to be deleted.

Filters.description: Filters applied to the certificate described in the form of key-value pairs.

Marker.description: An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the marker, up to the value specified by MaxRecords.

MaxRecords.description:
The maximum number of records to include in the response. If more records exist than the specified MaxRecords value, a pagination token called a marker is included in the response so that the remaining results can be retrieved.

Default: 10

Valid filter names: endpoint-arn | replication-instance-arn

Filters applied to the describe table statistics action.

A combination of filters creates an AND condition where each record matches all specified filters.

ReplicationTaskArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication task.

ServiceAccessRoleArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the service access IAM role.

CertificateArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used for SSL connection to the endpoint.

DatabaseName.description: The name of the database at the endpoint.

DynamoDbSettings.description: The settings for the target DynamoDB database. For more information, see the DynamoDBSettings structure.

EndpointArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.

EndpointIdentifier.description: The database endpoint identifier. Identifiers must begin with a letter; must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens; and must not end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

EngineName.description: The database engine name. Valid values, depending on the EndPointType, include MYSQL, ORACLE, POSTGRES, MARIADB, AURORA, REDSHIFT, S3, SYBASE, DYNAMODB, MONGODB, and SQLSERVER.

ExternalId.description: Value returned by a call to CreateEndpoint that can be used for cross-account validation. Use it on a subsequent call to CreateEndpoint to create the endpoint with a cross-account.

ExtraConnectionAttributes.description: Additional connection attributes used to connect to the endpoint.

KmsKeyId.description: The KMS key identifier that will be used to encrypt the connection parameters. If you do not specify a value for the KmsKeyId parameter, then AWS DMS will use your default encryption key. AWS KMS creates the default encryption key for your AWS account. Your AWS account has a different default encryption key for each AWS region.

MongoDbSettings.description: The settings for the MongoDB source endpoint. For more information, see the MongoDbSettings structure.

Port.description: The port value used to access the endpoint.

S3Settings.description: The settings for the S3 target endpoint. For more information, see the S3Settings structure.

ServerName.description: The name of the server at the endpoint.

SslMode.description:
The SSL mode used to connect to the endpoint.

SSL mode can be one of four values: none, require, verify-ca, verify-full.

The default value is none.

Username.description: The user name used to connect to the endpoint.

EventCategories.description: The event categories available for the specified source type.

SourceIdentifier.description:
The identifier of the event source. An identifier must begin with a letter and must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens; it cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

Constraints:replication instance, endpoint, migration task

SourceType.description:
The type of AWS DMS resource that generates events.

Valid values: replication-instance | endpoint | migration-task

EventCategories.description: A list of event categories for a SourceType that you want to subscribe to.

SourceType.description:
The type of AWS DMS resource that generates events.

Valid values: replication-instance | replication-server | security-group | migration-task

CustSubscriptionId.description: The AWS DMS event notification subscription Id.

CustomerAwsId.description: The AWS customer account associated with the AWS DMS event notification subscription.

Enabled.description: Boolean value that indicates if the event subscription is enabled.

SnsTopicArn.description: The topic ARN of the AWS DMS event notification subscription.

SourceIdsList.description: A list of source Ids for the event subscription.

SourceType.description:
The type of AWS DMS resource that generates events.

Valid values: replication-instance | replication-server | security-group | migration-task

Status.description:
The status of the AWS DMS event notification subscription.

Constraints:

Can be one of the following: creating | modifying | deleting | active | no-permission | topic-not-exist

The status "no-permission" indicates that AWS DMS no longer has permission to post to the SNS topic. The status "topic-not-exist" indicates that the topic was deleted after the subscription was created.

SubscriptionCreationTime.description: The time the RDS event notification subscription was created.

CertificateIdentifier.description: The customer-assigned name of the certificate. Valid characters are A-z and 0-9.

CertificatePem.description: The contents of the .pem X.509 certificate file for the certificate.

CertificateWallet.description: The location of the imported Oracle Wallet certificate for use with SSL.

Tags.description: The tags associated with the certificate.

InsufficientResourceCapacityFault.description: There are not enough resources allocated to the database migration.
InsufficientResourceCapacityFault.title: InsufficientResourceCapacityFault

InvalidResourceStateFault.description: The resource is in a state that prevents it from being used for database migration.
InvalidResourceStateFault.title: InvalidResourceStateFault

KMSKeyNotAccessibleFault.description: AWS DMS cannot access the KMS key.
KMSKeyNotAccessibleFault.title: KMSKeyNotAccessibleFault

ResourceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the AWS DMS resource.

TagList.description: A list of tags for the resource.

CertificateArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate used for SSL connection.

DatabaseName.description: The name of the endpoint database.

DynamoDbSettings.description: Settings in JSON format for the target Amazon DynamoDB endpoint. For more information about the available settings, see the Using Object Mapping to Migrate Data to DynamoDB section at Using an Amazon DynamoDB Database as a Target for AWS Database Migration Service.

EndpointArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.

EndpointIdentifier.description: The database endpoint identifier. Identifiers must begin with a letter; must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens; and must not end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

EngineName.description: The type of engine for the endpoint. Valid values, depending on the EndPointType, include MYSQL, ORACLE, POSTGRES, MARIADB, AURORA, REDSHIFT, S3, DYNAMODB, MONGODB, SYBASE, and SQLSERVER.

ExtraConnectionAttributes.description: Additional attributes associated with the connection. To reset this parameter, pass the empty string ("") as an argument.

MongoDbSettings.description: Settings in JSON format for the source MongoDB endpoint. For more information about the available settings, see the Configuration Properties When Using MongoDB as a Source for AWS Database Migration Service section at Using Amazon S3 as a Target for AWS Database Migration Service.

Password.description: The password to be used to login to the endpoint database.

Port.description: The port used by the endpoint database.

S3Settings.description: Settings in JSON format for the target S3 endpoint. For more information about the available settings, see the Extra Connection Attributes section at Using Amazon S3 as a Target for AWS Database Migration Service.

ServerName.description: The name of the server where the endpoint database resides.

SslMode.description:
The SSL mode to be used.

SSL mode can be one of four values: none, require, verify-ca, verify-full.

The default value is none.

Username.description: The user name to be used to login to the endpoint database.

Enabled.description: A Boolean value; set to true to activate the subscription.

EventCategories.description: A list of event categories for a source type that you want to subscribe to. Use the DescribeEventCategories action to see a list of event categories.

SnsTopicArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic created for event notification. The ARN is created by Amazon SNS when you create a topic and subscribe to it.

SourceType.description:
The type of AWS DMS resource that generates the events you want to subscribe to.

Valid values: replication-instance | migration-task

SubscriptionName.description: The name of the AWS DMS event notification subscription to be modified.

AllocatedStorage.description: The amount of storage (in gigabytes) to be allocated for the replication instance.

AllowMajorVersionUpgrade.description:
Indicates that major version upgrades are allowed. Changing this parameter does not result in an outage and the change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible.

Constraints: This parameter must be set to true when specifying a value for the EngineVersion parameter that is a different major version than the replication instance's current version.

ApplyImmediately.description: Indicates whether the changes should be applied immediately or during the next maintenance window.

AutoMinorVersionUpgrade.description: Indicates that minor version upgrades will be applied automatically to the replication instance during the maintenance window. Changing this parameter does not result in an outage except in the following case and the change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible. An outage will result if this parameter is set to true during the maintenance window, and a newer minor version is available, and AWS DMS has enabled auto patching for that engine version.

EngineVersion.description: The engine version number of the replication instance.

MultiAZ.description: Specifies if the replication instance is a Multi-AZ deployment. You cannot set the AvailabilityZone parameter if the Multi-AZ parameter is set to true.

PreferredMaintenanceWindow.description:
The weekly time range (in UTC) during which system maintenance can occur, which might result in an outage. Changing this parameter does not result in an outage, except in the following situation, and the change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible. If moving this window to the current time, there must be at least 30 minutes between the current time and end of the window to ensure pending changes are applied.

Default: Uses existing setting

Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi

Valid Days: Mon | Tue | Wed | Thu | Fri | Sat | Sun

Constraints: Must be at least 30 minutes

ReplicationInstanceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.

ReplicationInstanceClass.description:
The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance.

Valid Values: dms.t2.micro | dms.t2.small | dms.t2.medium | dms.t2.large | dms.c4.large | dms.c4.xlarge | dms.c4.2xlarge | dms.c4.4xlarge

ReplicationInstanceIdentifier.description: The replication instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a lowercase string.

VpcSecurityGroupIds.description: Specifies the VPC security group to be used with the replication instance. The VPC security group must work with the VPC containing the replication instance.

ReplicationSubnetGroupDescription.description: The description of the replication instance subnet group.

ReplicationSubnetGroupIdentifier.description: The name of the replication instance subnet group.

CdcStartTime.description: The start time for the Change Data Capture (CDC) operation.

MigrationType.description:
The migration type.

Valid values: full-load | cdc | full-load-and-cdc

ReplicationTaskArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication task.

ReplicationTaskIdentifier.description:
The replication task identifier.

Constraints:

  • Must contain from 1 to 255 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.

  • First character must be a letter.

  • Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

ReplicationTaskSettings.description: JSON file that contains settings for the task, such as target metadata settings.

TableMappings.description:
When using the AWS CLI or boto3, provide the path of the JSON file that contains the table mappings. Precede the path with "file://". When working with the DMS API, provide the JSON as the parameter value.

For example, --table-mappings file://mappingfile.json

ReplicationTask.description: The replication task that was modified.

AuthMechanism.description:
The authentication mechanism you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.

Valid values: DEFAULT, MONGODB_CR, SCRAM_SHA_1

DEFAULT For MongoDB version 2.x, use MONGODB_CR. For MongoDB version 3.x, use SCRAM_SHA_1. This attribute is not used when authType=No.

AuthSource.description:
The MongoDB database name. This attribute is not used when authType=NO.

The default is admin.

AuthType.description:
The authentication type you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.

Valid values: NO, PASSWORD

When NO is selected, user name and password parameters are not used and can be empty.

DatabaseName.description: The database name on the MongoDB source endpoint.

DocsToInvestigate.description:
Indicates the number of documents to preview to determine the document organization. Use this attribute when NestingLevel is set to ONE.

Must be a positive value greater than 0. Default value is 1000.

ExtractDocId.description:
Specifies the document ID. Use this attribute when NestingLevel is set to NONE.

Default value is false.

NestingLevel.description:
Specifies either document or table mode.

Valid values: NONE, ONE

Default value is NONE. Specify NONE to use document mode. Specify ONE to use table mode.

Password.description: The password for the user account you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.

Port.description: The port value for the MongoDB source endpoint.

ServerName.description: The name of the server on the MongoDB source endpoint.

Username.description: The user name you use to access the MongoDB source endpoint.

DefaultAllocatedStorage.description: The default amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the replication instance.

EngineVersion.description: The version of the replication engine.

IncludedAllocatedStorage.description: The amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the replication instance.

MaxAllocatedStorage.description: The minimum amount of storage (in gigabytes) that can be allocated for the replication instance.

MinAllocatedStorage.description: The minimum amount of storage (in gigabytes) that can be allocated for the replication instance.

ReplicationInstanceClass.description:
The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance.

Valid Values: dms.t2.micro | dms.t2.small | dms.t2.medium | dms.t2.large | dms.c4.large | dms.c4.xlarge | dms.c4.2xlarge | dms.c4.4xlarge

StorageType.description: The type of storage used by the replication instance.

EndpointArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.

ReplicationInstanceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.

RefreshSchemasStatus.description: The status of the refreshed schema.

EndpointArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.

LastFailureMessage.description: The last failure message for the schema.

LastRefreshDate.description: The date the schema was last refreshed.

ReplicationInstanceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.

ReplicationTaskArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.

TablesToReload.description: The name and schema of the table to be reloaded.

ReplicationTaskArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication task.

ResourceArn.description: >The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS DMS resource the tag is to be removed from.

TagKeys.description: The tag key (name) of the tag to be removed.

AllocatedStorage.description: The amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the replication instance.

AutoMinorVersionUpgrade.description: Boolean value indicating if minor version upgrades will be automatically applied to the instance.

AvailabilityZone.description: The Availability Zone for the instance.

EngineVersion.description: The engine version number of the replication instance.

InstanceCreateTime.description: The time the replication instance was created.

KmsKeyId.description: The KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the content on the replication instance. If you do not specify a value for the KmsKeyId parameter, then AWS DMS will use your default encryption key. AWS KMS creates the default encryption key for your AWS account. Your AWS account has a different default encryption key for each AWS region.

MultiAZ.description: Specifies if the replication instance is a Multi-AZ deployment. You cannot set the AvailabilityZone parameter if the Multi-AZ parameter is set to true.

PreferredMaintenanceWindow.description: The maintenance window times for the replication instance.

PubliclyAccessible.description: Specifies the accessibility options for the replication instance. A value of true represents an instance with a public IP address. A value of false represents an instance with a private IP address. The default value is true.

ReplicationInstanceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.

ReplicationInstanceClass.description:
The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance.

Valid Values: dms.t2.micro | dms.t2.small | dms.t2.medium | dms.t2.large | dms.c4.large | dms.c4.xlarge | dms.c4.2xlarge | dms.c4.4xlarge

ReplicationInstanceIdentifier.description:
The replication instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a lowercase string.

Constraints:

  • Must contain from 1 to 63 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.

  • First character must be a letter.

  • Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

Example: myrepinstance

ReplicationInstancePrivateIpAddress.description: The private IP address of the replication instance.

ReplicationInstancePrivateIpAddresses.description: The private IP address of the replication instance.

ReplicationInstancePublicIpAddress.description: The public IP address of the replication instance.

ReplicationInstancePublicIpAddresses.description: The public IP address of the replication instance.

ReplicationInstanceStatus.description: The status of the replication instance.

ReplicationSubnetGroup.description: The subnet group for the replication instance.

SecondaryAvailabilityZone.description: The availability zone of the standby replication instance in a Multi-AZ deployment.

VpcSecurityGroups.description: The VPC security group for the instance.

AllocatedStorage.description: The amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the replication instance.

EngineVersion.description: The engine version number of the replication instance.

MultiAZ.description: Specifies if the replication instance is a Multi-AZ deployment. You cannot set the AvailabilityZone parameter if the Multi-AZ parameter is set to true.

ReplicationInstanceClass.description:
The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance.

Valid Values: dms.t2.micro | dms.t2.small | dms.t2.medium | dms.t2.large | dms.c4.large | dms.c4.xlarge | dms.c4.2xlarge | dms.c4.4xlarge

ReplicationSubnetGroupDescription.description: The description of the replication subnet group.

ReplicationSubnetGroupIdentifier.description: The identifier of the replication instance subnet group.

SubnetGroupStatus.description: The status of the subnet group.

Subnets.description: The subnets that are in the subnet group.

ReplicationSubnetGroupDoesNotCoverEnough.description: The replication subnet group does not cover enough Availability Zones (AZs). Edit the replication subnet group and add more AZs.
ReplicationSubnetGroupDoesNotCoverEnough.title: ReplicationSubnetGroupDoesNotCoverEnoughAZs

LastFailureMessage.description: The last error (failure) message generated for the replication instance.

ReplicationInstanceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.

ReplicationTaskArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication task.

ReplicationTaskCreationDate.description: The date the replication task was created.

ReplicationTaskIdentifier.description:
The replication task identifier.

Constraints:

  • Must contain from 1 to 255 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.

  • First character must be a letter.

  • Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

ReplicationTaskSettings.description: The settings for the replication task.

ReplicationTaskStartDate.description: The date the replication task is scheduled to start.

ReplicationTaskStats.description: The statistics for the task, including elapsed time, tables loaded, and table errors.

SourceEndpointArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.

Status.description: The status of the replication task.

StopReason.description: The reason the replication task was stopped.

TableMappings.description: Table mappings specified in the task.

TargetEndpointArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.

ElapsedTimeMillis.description: The elapsed time of the task, in milliseconds.

FullLoadProgressPercent.description: The percent complete for the full load migration task.

TablesErrored.description: The number of errors that have occurred during this task.

TablesLoaded.description: The number of tables loaded for this task.

TablesLoading.description: The number of tables currently loading for this task.

TablesQueued.description: The number of tables queued for this task.

ResourceAlreadyExistsFault.description: The resource you are attempting to create already exists.
ResourceAlreadyExistsFault.title: ResourceAlreadyExistsFault

ResourceNotFoundFault.description: The resource could not be found.
ResourceNotFoundFault.title: ResourceNotFoundFault

ResourceQuotaExceededFault.description: The quota for this resource quota has been exceeded.
ResourceQuotaExceededFault.title: ResourceQuotaExceededFault

BucketFolder.description: An optional parameter to set a folder name in the S3 bucket. If provided, tables are created in the path <bucketFolder>/<schema_name>/<table_name>/. If this parameter is not specified, then the path used is <schema_name>/<table_name>/.

BucketName.description: The name of the S3 bucket.

CompressionType.description: An optional parameter to use GZIP to compress the target files. Set to GZIP to compress the target files. Set to NONE (the default) or do not use to leave the files uncompressed.

CsvDelimiter.description: The delimiter used to separate columns in the source files. The default is a comma.

CsvRowDelimiter.description: The delimiter used to separate rows in the source files. The default is a carriage return (\n).

ServiceAccessRoleArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used by the service access IAM role.

SNSNoAuthorizationFault.description: You are not authorized for the SNS subscription.
SNSNoAuthorizationFault.title: SNSNoAuthorizationFault

CdcStartTime.description: The start time for the Change Data Capture (CDC) operation.

ReplicationTaskArn.description: The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the replication task to be started.
The Amazon Resource Number(ARN) of the replication task to be stopped.

StorageQuotaExceededFault.description: The storage quota has been exceeded.
StorageQuotaExceededFault.title: StorageQuotaExceededFault

SubnetAvailabilityZone.description: The Availability Zone of the subnet.

SubnetAlreadyInUse.description: The specified subnet is already in use.
SubnetAlreadyInUse.title: SubnetAlreadyInUse

EngineName.description: The database engine name. Valid values, depending on the EndPointType, include MYSQL, ORACLE, POSTGRES, MARIADB, AURORA, REDSHIFT, S3, SYBASE, DYNAMODB, MONGODB, and SQLSERVER.

SupportsCDC.description: Indicates if Change Data Capture (CDC) is supported.

Ddls.description: The Data Definition Language (DDL) used to build and modify the structure of your tables.

Deletes.description: The number of delete actions performed on a table.

FullLoadCondtnlChkFailedRows.description: The number of rows that failed conditional checks during the Full Load operation (valid only for DynamoDB as a target migrations).

FullLoadErrorRows.description: The number of rows that failed to load during the Full Load operation (valid only for DynamoDB as a target migrations).

FullLoadRows.description: The number of rows added during the Full Load operation.

Inserts.description: The number of insert actions performed on a table.

LastUpdateTime.description: The last time the table was updated.

TableState.description:
The state of the tables described.

Valid states: Table does not exist | Before load | Full load | Table completed | Table cancelled | Table error | Table all | Table updates | Table is being reloaded

Updates.description: The number of update actions performed on a table.

SchemaName.description: The schema name of the table to be reloaded.

TableName.description: The table name of the table to be reloaded.

Key.description: A key is the required name of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with "aws:" or "dms:". The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java regex: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").

Value.description: A value is the optional value of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with "aws:" or "dms:". The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java regex: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").

EndpointArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the endpoint.

ReplicationInstanceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.

UpgradeDependencyFailureFault.description: An upgrade dependency is preventing the database migration.
UpgradeDependencyFailureFault.title: UpgradeDependencyFailureFault

Status.description: The status of the VPC security group.
